review.title: excellent location for Airport
review.reviewText: This was our 4th stay at this hotel so that should speak for itself. Immaculately clean, very comfortable rooms and excellent breakfast.  They also provide pick-up/drop-off for airport, which I'd recommend after a long flight from the UK.  Cannot fault this hotel at all and it would always be our 1st choice when looking for a hotel convenient for airport location.

review.title: Bait and Switch
review.reviewText: We booked a king sized room.  When we arrived our room was one with 2 double beds facing the bayside.  When I went down to the front desk to inquire about this they told me that this room was an Expedia upgrade being a VIP member.  I said that it was nice to be upgraded but that it should be in the size bed that was requested in the original reservation.  I was then moved to a regular king sized room however this room was made for a special needs individual.  Again we did not ask for this type of room at the time of booking.  They clearly had rented out the other king sized rooms and put us in whatever they had even though we had made our reservation 6 weeks ago.  Similar situations have happened to us before and I do not feel when you book on Expedia the hotels actually give you their better rooms just the rooms that are the last ones to fill up. What is even more disappointing is that we were repeat guests.
review.positiveRemarks: Location to the airport
review.negativeRemarks: Honor the original reservation

review.title: Very good hotel.  Many positives, few improvements
review.reviewText:
Spent three nights at the hotel and overall our stay at Bay Landing Hotel was pleasing.   Many positives such as free parking, clean rooms, quiet--albeit it was near the airport, our room #327 had a wonderful view of the bay and we could watch the jets take off and land, excellent paved walking/jogging path that goes up and down the bay.  

Free breakfast, but some breakfast items one needed to heated or reheated with the microwave as they were preprocessed frozen items ie bacon, sausage patty, omelets, ham, & a hash-brown potato wedge.   They did have three waffle irons for fresh made waffles.  Plenty of sliced and diced fruit and hot oatmeal.  Four different juice options and hot coffee. Their breakfast is nowhere as good as one's done by Embassy Suites, but it wasn't horrible either.   I just stayed away from the items one needed to zap in the microwave.    The breakfast dinning area is also small and congested.  Overall their breakfast was OK, but that is a good thing as I didn't overeat.    

Our room was extremely clean and spacious.  Beds were a bit small but comfortable.  They could have placed another bed or sofa couch in there to occupy the open "dead" space as the room had too much un-utilized space.  I recommend that they replace the their double sized beds with queens or king sized ones.  To be fair, they may have had rooms with double queens, but this room was the only one available for us when we booked.  

Bottom line---We would stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Very good hotel near the airport with many good restaurants close by in Burlingame.
review.negativeRemarks: Highly unlikely-- but copy what Embassy Suites does for their breakfast.   Replace all smaller double mattresses with queens.
review.locationRemarks: Many dinning options close by.  We found an awesome place for meals call Urban Bistro.  Excellent food and they are fast & reasonably priced.

review.title: Great Hotel and location
review.reviewText: My husband and I recently stayed at the Bay Landing Hotel and were beyond happy with our experience. I usually do not post reviews but I feel I need to because this hotel was excellent. First, let me say that I am a "clean freak" and very picky with hotels. etc. It was my first visit to the San Francisco area and my husband's second. We flew into San Diego to attend my nephew's wedding and then drove up the coast, stayed 1 night in an average Quality Inn along the way, and then planted ourselves in this gem about 20 minutes south of San Francisco. The hotel was beautiful -  nice furniture, clean beyond clean, comfortable king size bed, free breakfast, and a very friendly and helpful staff. The price wasn't bad either considering the location. SF hotels in general are expensive so we thought this was moderately priced. It was close to the airport and Rt. 101. So a quick ride up the road to the entrance of the Rt. 101 Freeway took us quickly to the city, which we both enjoyed visiting! Thank you Bay Landing staff for making this a memorable trip for my husband and I. We will definitely recommend this hotel to our family and friends visiting the SF area.
review.positiveRemarks: Everything! Location, cleanliness, friendly staff and price compared to other SF area hotels.
review.negativeRemarks: It just was busy during breakfast which is to be expected. We went during the busy season and there were a lot of tourists!/ Food was good and free.
review.locationRemarks: Great location! Minutes to the SF airport, 20-25 minutes to SF City, restaurants and shopping close by.

Fortunately, this hotel, which I used to stay often 10 years ago, still remain clean, warm, cozy without much LED lighting yet unlike most recently renovated hotels all over. The only LED lighting found was the ones on top of coffee maker, which I could unplug to make it disabled. Air, staff, also coffee were pretty good by the comtemporary free hotel coffee standard. I would strongly recommend this hotel.
review.locationRemarks: No LED lighting anywhere.

food - didn't try the complimentary breakfast.

review.reviewText:

(Minor) cons: no restaurants & bars in the hotel, so if you stay here long you don't have many things to do in the evening; lack of service staff (If cleaning staff forgot to put shampoo in your room, you have to go to front dest by yourself to fetch it because they don't have room services. It's not that bad to have some extra walk.)

All in all, we enjoyed our 3-night stay at the hotel and do recommend it.

review.title: Great location - solid value proposition
review.reviewText: Rooms are hard to come by in the Bay Area and the laws of supply and demand place you, the customer, at a disadvantage.  This hotel is the essence of a value proposition - good price relative to those around it and not a bad hotel.  Very clean room and bathroom - which is the most important thing.  Very quiet when I was there.  View was street-side, so ugh.  Staff was fine - though non-existent when I got coffee at 3 am (I was on an East Coast clock) - BUT they have 24 hour coffee, tea and water downstairs.  That was a huge plus.  Look if you need to grab some sleep before or after a flight, this is the place to go.

review.title: 3 night stay. Nothing but great!
review.reviewText:
We upgraded to a bay view room for a nominal fee. Well worth it. Able watch planes take off & land without hearing a thing! Or if we chose, could open windows (the usual 4-5") & experience the salty air, powerful sounds of 747,s etc. Room was exceptionally clean & comfortable. Nice mattress & linens, though polyester bedspread was suprising - mildly disappointing. Cozy robe also provided! !ot the usual for a 3-star. All staff we came in contact with were friendly & helpful. 
The breakfast buffet was unique (in our experience) in that the "hot" items were on ice. Included pre-prepared omelets, ham, bacon, sausage, potatoes. 3 microwaves available to keep wait times to a minimum. Extensive options for all breakfast items. Bayside patio seating available. Able to take advantage of it one morning. An excellent way to start the day. 
If we return to SF Bay area, this is where we will stay. Great value.

review.title: No internet in Silicon Valley
review.reviewText: The only thing to do at an airport hotel is get caught up on things -- but not here -- no working Internet the entire time..  Not only that, the staff didn't even try to fix it -- just passed technical services on to myself and other guests.  So we paid to stay in a hotel with no internet and we got to waste our time talking to technical services (who could find nothing -- it was simply insufficient service for a hotel).  But I guess we had nothing else to do anyway given that we had no internet and were at the airport....  There were more service issues too, not to mention all the little ants in my bathroom, but this should be enough to convince others to choose one of the numerous other airport hotels near SFO.  Working Internet service is a necessity, not a luxury. We couldn't even check in for our flights.

The staff were very nice.  Martin and Tony (on the desk) could not have been more helpful and understanding of my special circumstances. I think that the rooms are mostly the same but the ones facing the water have a nicer view.  
Note that the hi way 101 interchange with Broadway is a real mess and dangerous, especially at night, so watch out.

review.title: Pleasant place to stay by the airport
review.reviewText: This is a nice hotel, but seems to be a little pricey for what you get.  The staff and condition of the hotel were excellent.  However, in an effort to save a few pennies, the hotel designer elected to make the bathroom lights motion activated with the bathroom doors automatically closing.  If you like to leave the bathroom light on at night with the bathroom door ajar like I do for visibility when you have to get up in the middle of the night, you are out of luck.  You either have to leave a light on in the room or get up in pitch darkness, neither of which seems like a good choice to me.
review.positiveRemarks: Hotel condition and staff.
review.negativeRemarks: The motion activated lights and automatically closing doors need to be eliminated.

managementResponses.response: Thank you, Harvey, for your repeat business. We appreciate your candor about your recent experience. I am sorry that you did not get a pleasant nights sleep before your early morning flight. Please know that we do have timer cycles on our ice machines set so as not to disturb guests in the evening time. We honor requests of room type and location as best we can. Additionally, we have sleep kits available for added comfort.We value your feedback, and do hope to see you again on your next visit from Toronto.

review.title: Thoughtless staff
review.reviewText: We stayed at the hotel for just one night as we had an early flight out of SFO. Our previous experience here was good. But, with what we later found, was not a full hotel, we were allocated a room beside an elevator and ice making machine, by front desk staff who knew we were leaving very early. After we went to bed we were woken every hour for the first 3 hours. A terrible night which could easily have been avoided

review.title: Visiting San Francisco
review.reviewText: We stayed for three nights after returning from Maui and before returning to Chicago.  We wanted to be close to the city but not in the city.  We wanted to avoid the parking nightmare in San Francisco and also be close to the airport when we flew home.  This hotel satisfied both of these factors.  The bonus of the breakfast, which was a cook to order including everything you could want, ensured that we got off to a great start before visiting the city.  The drive to the city was only about 20 minutes.  The drive to the airport was less than 10 minutes.  In fact, we enjoyed watching the planes take off and land from the back porch of the hotel over the bay.  Our room was spacious and comfortable.  The interior and exterior of the hotel was very pleasing.  We will definitely book it again when returning to San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: We liked being close to the airport and the city.
review.negativeRemarks: I really can't think of anything that would need improvement.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is literally a few miles to the airport and only a 20 minute drive into the city.

review.title: Really Great Overnight
review.reviewText: We had a really great stay at Bay Landing Hotel.  The hotel is clean perfectly located for an overnight before a flight.  We had a car but there is shuttle service to the airport which is literally 5 minutes away.  Our room was great! Clean and comfortable.  We didn't have a view of the bay but that was ok with us.  There is a nice walkway around the back of the hotel along the bay.  You can watch planes arrive and depart from SFO.  We were very pleased.  The only negatives were the towels which were a little small and not at all soft and the powered non-dairy creamer in the room,which I just personally do not like.  We did not have breakfast, but it is available.  I did enjoy the coffee in the cafe area which had much better creamer :)

review.negativeRemarks: Better towels and liquid non-dairy creamer in the room.

review.title: San Francisco Bay View
review.reviewText:
We were pleasantly surprised to find out that we were give a free top floor upgrade with a nice bay view.

The room, linens, and bathrooms were clean so that is the most important thing.

The staff was fine, although they may have had more local knowledge to share; i.e., restaurants, etc. Little things, such as a jeweler's screwdriver for my glasses would have been handy to have.  

The included breakfast could have been improved on.  Many items were precooked or frozen, and there were only three microwaves to heat everything up.  I would have preferred fewer ingredients, and had fresh hash browns and eggs, for example.

However, would be happy to stay again, and just stick to bagels!

review.title: Family run, friendly and close to the airport
review.reviewText:
The Bay Landing has an enviable location on the public shore, five minutes drive from the Airport. It's comfy, and clean and welcoming. It is also a 'limited facility' property, so only offers a small shop of nibbles and soft drinks, and a breakfast service of microwavable, and self service options. (So the waffle makers are sparkling clean, but the batter is pre-packaged.)

If you look in the drawer of your room, there is a Room Service menu from a third party company. I only found it on my last night, so can't tell you if the pizza really is delicious, but you would have to find a place to buy your own beer, should you want a brew with your order. 

There are local eateries within seconds of the entrance - Mexican next door, Benihana and a strange Asian American fusion place a couple more minutes away. Don't be fooled by the feeling of 'nobody home' - you are very likely to walk into a 20 minute wait, surrounded by family celebrations, in spaces showing signs of constant hard use. I ended up in the bar at Benihana - which is more my style, particularly when I'm traveling alone, and I have to say that it is an area in need of a darn good clean and a bit of management tlc. The Marriot proved to be a more pleasant option, worth strolling for another five minutes.
review.positiveRemarks: Price, proximity - and the morning shuttle driver is a honey.
review.negativeRemarks: The shuttle is only once every 30 minutes.

When we arrived that first night, we found it to be a very short distance from the airport and our rental car
area making it easy to make our connections and transportation. The staff we met were helpful and available.
The room we stayed in was spacious, clean and comfortable with a large, beautiful bathroom with a walk-in shower.
Our room the last night, I paid an extra $20 for it to be facing the water. It turned out to give us a sunrise that was
spectacular with the same comfortable and spacious room. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone whether they utilizing the airport or not. We will use this hotel when and if we fly in to the area again.

review.title: Breathtaking
review.reviewText: During my stay I enjoyed everything. The check-in/out process was great. Francis(Manager) made me feel welcomed. The breakfast selection was awesome-more than just muffins, waffles, eggs etc...you get the works. It's a 5 minute drive from the airport if taking the courtesy shuttle. If traveling to downtown-it's easier/cheaper to take the BART at Milbrae Station to Powell St-you can access the BART near the Fairfield Inn if you take the shuttle it's only 2 blocks away from the station (you can't walk to Milbrae Station). As far as restaurants near the hotel-I ate at the Elephant Bar (you will have a choice of everything-great atmosphere). If interested in site seeing-I used City Sight Seeing Tour Company-great views on the double decker bus -package was $104 for 72 hrs. which included everything and  a tour of Alcatraz (you must make reservations for Alcatraz-it sells out very fast). The weather was great 63-68 degrees- make sure you have a coat everyday. I would stay here again definitely.

review.title: Good location, great staff
review.reviewText:
The staff was helpful in advising us how to get to the sights we wanted to visit in San Francisco, using both the bus and BART.  We could use their free airport shuttle to get back to the airport to board BART as well as to return to the hotel, not just for flights.  This bus runs every 35 minutes.

The hotel is in the process of renovating and everything looks very nice.  Their breakfast is very good and has a decent selection of items.  It is within very short walking distance of 3 good restaurants and there is a great walking path along the bay in both directions from the hotel.  Although it is very close to the landing/takeoff runways and there is constant jet traffic, our bay view room was quiet - it seems to be well sound proofed.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfort, proximity to airport and public transportation.

review.title: Big rooms, first class staff
review.reviewText:
Very happy with my choice of the Bay Landing. Rooms are big and ultra clean, some have a nice view of the Bay for great sunsets. My kids loved watching the planes landing as the hotel has a great view of Rnway 28L and 28R, which are used concurrently at this busy airport. There is very little plane noise in the room though.

Vivian on the front desk was a star and did so much for us to make our stay comfortable and relaxing. You would be hard pressed to find someone so dedicated to customer service and as hard working as this lady!

The hotel has a nice outdoor seating area and a decent gym. Everything is so clean and well maintained.

The minus points - they are few, but poor internet at peak times proved annoying. The connection was so bad I struggled to get web pages to render and my VOIO phone didn't work. The breakfast room is small and crowded. Get down to breakfast early if you want a seat.
review.positiveRemarks: Big rooms. Little noise from other people. Comfortable and relaxing
review.negativeRemarks: HD TV is absent. WiFi poor to inadequate
review.locationRemarks: Great location near SF and easy access to the coast. Recommend a trip to Santa Cruz down Hwy 1. Try Pescadero Beach at sunset!

review.title: Nice hotel close to the airport
review.reviewText: I was very happy with our experience with Bay Landing.  When we made the reservation, I asked that our room be close to my mothers and we were given adjoining rooms, which was really nice.  We were right next to the elevator and we never heard any noise.  The beds were very comfortable and the sheets were very soft.  When we checked in, Vivian (I think that was her name) was very helpful and provided us with the airport shuttle schedule.  The next day, she called over to the Elephant Bar and put our name on the list.  She was very nice.  My only complaint was the breakfast.  I didn't like that everything had to be microwaved.  At one point, my husband went to make a waffle and the waffle machine broke in his hand.  He stood with batter all over his hands, trying to keep more of it from going onto the floor.  I asked the employee in the kitchen area for help and she looked at him and then very slowly went over and found a rag and then very slowly came back and helped him with the batter.  Didn't ruin our day, but it did put a damper on the beginning of it.  All, in all, I would highly recommend the hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: The rooms were large and the beds were very comfortable.  Employee at the front desk was very helpful
review.negativeRemarks: The breakfast.
review.locationRemarks: It was nice having Elephant Bar and El Torito in the parking lot.

There was a lot of variety at breakfast, but taking turns at the microwave ovens is a little lengthy and everything is served cold, so you cant really skip it. It's not a real problem, but it could be frustrating if you're in a hurry. There are 2 nice restaurants next to the hotel as well. Overall it is a nice place to stay near the airport or if on business in the area, I would stay here again.

review.title: Still the Best and Getting Better
review.reviewText: This is the best place to base a Bay Area trip for many reasons:  1.  RIGHT ON THE BAY with walking paths, etc.  2.  Refrigerator and Microwave in room.  3.  Separate bath and shower luxury.  Also grantie countertops.  4.  Really decent breakfast with great variety (I love the Guava Juice!).  4.  FREE WI-FI.  5.  I was pleased to find new luxurious carpeting and a 36 inch flat screen TV this visit!  Oh, and by far the best thing, 6.  FREE PARKING in a quiet lot.  Don't be fooled by the airport location.  I consider this a luxury hotel masquerading as a 3-star airport inn.  I would however, expect a furniture upgrade soon.
review.positiveRemarks: Most everything.  See above.  Forgot to mention there are free shuttles to the airport to catch BART if you are without a car.  CALTRAN is nearby too.

review.title: Just one night

Wonderful breakfast the next Morning with pancakes, frech muffins, fruits, eggs, juices, cereals,...
Only negative points:
-Free shuttle to/from airport only every 35 mins. So waiting on arrival in the night 20 mins at the cold Airport busstop -not nice!!
-Aircondition in the room was too cold and could not be arranged for warmer.

managementResponses.response: Thank you, Rosy, for commenting on our great value and very comfortable rooms. We are glad that you enjoyed your experience at Bay Landing, and look forward to your next stay with us!

review.title: Great value, very comfortable!

overnight stay
room very comfortable and clean
complimentary breakfast was excellent
staff was most helpful and willing to assist us
I would definitely stay at this hotel time and time again

review.title: Very comfortable rooms
review.reviewText:
The room was huge. I got a corner suite..so the size was big. 

The room has coffee maker,  fridge, microwave in our room, so it was very convenient. 

I stayed in this hotel two years ago, and I felt like breakfast got worst. Last time the breakfast impressed me and this time I was kind of upset... everything comes cold so you need to microwave everything..didn't like it.

But in general, the hotel is very convenient and comfortable, so i would definitely recommend this hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, parking and breakfast included
review.negativeRemarks: The breakfast

review.title: You've Got to meet Mr.Hightower!
review.reviewText: Have stayed here many years. Love the view, the breakfast, the staff and you must meet Mr. Hightower the shuttle bus driver.H e has a velvet voice, great     selection of information and music. He is a great driver and even remembers us as we return.

Room was clean as I expected.Slept comforably except our room was the last one by the back door and each time some opened and closed door it made noise in our room fortunately, I travel with ear plugs and it made it all better.The breakfast in the morning was good and we were pleasantly surprised with it. Its all that I expected.

review.title: Bad Hotel Shuttle
review.reviewText: The hotel do located near SFO, but the hotel shuttle sucks!!!  You may stand outside for an hour without having a Bay Landing Hotel shuttle coming.  If you choose to take the Bart(metro) , you gotta walk for half hour. If you take the bus, it runs every 60mins. I was forced to take the taxi, which made me very unsatisfied during this trip!

We look forward to seeing you again for your fourth stay!

review.title: Nice hotel, friendly staff, good breakfast.

Some of the upholstery on the chairs in the breakfast area were badly frayed and the room furniture needed some tender care, but it was a good hotel to stay at and visit the city.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenient location, clean and friendly stafff

review.locationRemarks: Easy to get to the airport, BART, and an easy drive into San Francisco.  Lots of good restaurants nearby.

review.title: Nice hotel with nice view to the bay.
review.reviewText: I did not get to spend too much time at this hotel because of an early flight. But the room and the lobby seems nice and well clean. They only thing I did not like is that the hotel transportation to the airport (2 miles away) get mad with me when I did not gave him a tip. I only had $10 and $20 and I don't think is right to give away $10 for a 4 minutes rides that it's supposed to be included on the hotel fare. In that case the hotel should let us know that we need to pay for the transportation so we can ask for change at the lobby. Or charge extra for the 2 miles ride, normally I did not carry cash with me.

We had a view of the bay and the SFO runway which was nice. The room was quiet. Complimentary breakfast was good and included a wide selection of foods for all diets. The Elephant Bar next door also serves a wide selection of good food at reasonable prices. We used public transit extensively on this vacation and the Samtrans bus #292 stops are within a block or two of the hotel.

review.title: excellent. definatelly will stay next time.

review.title: Highly Disappointed, Over Price & Worn Out!
review.reviewText: The only thing nice about this hotel experience was our check-in. We've stayed in 100's of hotels. This is the worst! Even our Super 8 last minute stay in Hayward was better. Cobwebs on window sill inside & out, plus windows so dirty blocked our bay view. Breakfast was beyond gross, too small of space for guests to re-heat foods, the only safe & edible item banana! Chairs worn down to threads on seats. My wife accidentally forgot her flannel covered pillows they claimed nothing found in room. Incredible waste of money. We wouldn't stay here again nor recommend it to anyone. Hyatt across the street looked beautiful.

review.negativeRemarks: The crockery, cutlery at breakfast and some more healthier foods

review.title: Easy access to San Francisco International SFO
review.reviewText:
In searching for a quality hotel for a one day trip into San Francisco International, used Expedia's rating system.

Checked in late due to FAA delay in flying from ORD/Chicago O'Hare to SFO, and met with courteous staff.  Too, baggage had been delayed in Chicago and was undelivered due to that delay.  Warren of the early morning (3 AM) shift at the front desk checked me in quickly, provided toothbrush, toothpaste and razor.  Also upon my departure a few hours later he was good enough to call a cab for me since had missed shuttle service and had to make 7.00 AM flight to Seattle ...again from SFO.

Room spacious, comfortable with all amenities.  The rating of this hotel for overall quality is a hidden gem category.
review.positiveRemarks: Quality of customer service as noted above.  Location to SFO, room comfort, quality of room amenities.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing substantive.
review.locationRemarks: Didn't have the opportunity to experience things to do.  Again location relative to SFO International was very suitable

managementResponses.response: Thank you for taking the time to comment on our complimentary breakfast, bathroom ventilation, and guest laundry. We are pleased that you enjoyed our bay front terrace, and that you had a nice experience with us. Your business is appreciated!

review.title: Nice hotel with great views of the bay.
review.reviewText: Stayed five nights at Bay Landing Hotel.  Enjoyed sitting out watching the aircraft take off and land over at SFO Airport.  Hotel has good facilities including a guest laundry.  If you don't have a car, there are only a limited number of restaurants nearby in easy walking distance.  Has a nice terrace on the bay side of the hotel with plenty of tables and seating.  Inside the lobby is a library and lounge area with TV, made a nice area to sit away from the room.
review.positiveRemarks: Great breakfast - included in the room rate is a continental breakfast - the best I've ever experienced, with a great range of food.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom ventilation inadequate and turns off at night. Needs to turn on earlier in the morning to remove the steam from shower.
review.locationRemarks: Good walks along the bay water edge.  Limited restaurants nearby unless you have a car.

Only downside was the time it took for the shuttle bus to pick us up at the airport. We waited nearly 1 hour before it arrived. However the morning pickup from the hotel was on time and quick. Overall a very good hotel & one I would stay in again.
review.negativeRemarks: Shuttle bus pickup times.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for sharing comments about your great experience at Bay Landing. We are happy to hear that you got to take advantage of many of our complimentary amenities. I will share your service compliments with our team. We look forward to seeing you again soon!

review.title: Great SFO hotel
review.reviewText: Stayed there for 3 nights on business in mid-September.  Room was not cheap, but It is competitive with other similar hotels by the sfo airport.  However, this hotel provides many amenities included in the room rate.  Free wifi. Nice walking path next to the hotel. Got a room with a beautiful water view.  Room was large.  Bed was a little soft.  Hotel well maintained and clean.   Every staff was friendly and welcoming.  Breakfast was very good. Made my waffle and loaded it with good toppings. A good choice of fresh fruits.  Watermelon, cantaloupe, grapes, orange, banana, kiwi, and papaya!  Fruit juices.  Free newspapers, coffee and tea throughout the day.  Free parking. For those guests that complained about the breakfast, please don't come to this hotel.  Less people staying there so they won't raise the room rates!  Will stay there again!

managementResponses.response: Thank you, Cheryl, for commenting on your fantastic stay at Bay Landing. We are thrilled to hear that you enjoyed our nicely appointed rooms, and that you got to experience our friendly and helpful team. Your business is appreciated!

review.title: Fantastic Hotel
review.reviewText: Absolutely beautiful hotel right on the bay and only minutes from the airport.  You can watch the airplanes take off and land at the airport, but hear absolutely no sounds from the airport in your room.  The rooms are nicely appointed, a good size and very clean.  The free breakfast every morning was great.  And the hotel staff was fantastic - friendly and helpful.

managementResponses.response: Thank you, Marc, for commenting on your recent experience at Bay Landing. We are pleased to hear that you enjoyed our comfortable beds and that you got to utilize our complimentary Internet services. We appreciate the opportunity to address your question about the video surveillance. The postings are to protect the privacy of our guests by alerting them that they may be recorded. The hotel is not a hot spot for crime. We will begin a renovation towards the end of this year, which will refresh our guest rooms. Thank you again for your patronage!

review.title: Hotel close to airport, but needs some TLC
review.reviewText:
Stayed at the hotel for one night when returning home from holiday.
Is close to airport and has free shuttle every 40 minutes to/from. 
The hotel is located right on the bay, facilities are okay, but during our late arrival to the hotel we found staff to be somewhat disinterested in our needs (there was no room service, but the hotel had a small shop that sold some food products). Breakfast was continental and was okay, nothing special.
Signs throughout the hotel indicated video surveillance was in progress - this didn't feel very welcoming and raised concern about why this was required - is this a hotspot for crime?
Bed was comfortable and hotel did offer free WiFi - room was clean, décor was tired and old fashioned throughout the hotel (threadbare rugs and seating at reception).
This is an airport hotel, so expectations were low, but we'd think twice about returning.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and free wifi. Free airport Shuttle.
review.negativeRemarks: Décor, staff attitude to guests. Breakfast could be more organised and fresher selection.
review.locationRemarks: Right on the bay (path allows you to walk along), close to the airport, but not much nearby other than hotels, nowhere that was open late.

Only had two issues. We kept having to have the keycards reprogrammed. We were told magnets could cause them to be deactivated. Took necessary precautions and still had the same issue. Water pressure for the shower in room 235 was extremely low. 

Otherwise, the staff was kind and helpful, rooms were clean and neat  and the breakfest was good. Good location and loved the fact that FireFly car rentals was within walking distance to pick-up and return a rental plus there were several great resturants within walking distance.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, staff, clean, neat and breakfest.
review.negativeRemarks: Water pressure in shower was terrible, but dealt with it. It wasn't worth the hassel to change rooms.

review.title: Wonderful Hotel
review.reviewText: I just completed a 3 night stay at the Bay Landing and I was very pleased with every aspect of the hotel. The check in was fast and friendly. My room was extremely clean and the bed was so comfortable. I enjoyed the breakfast every morning because they have so many options. Julio was working at the front desk when I checked in and I cannot say enough great things about him! He was so helpful with directions and advice on things to do. He booked a morning bus trip for me to see Muir Woods. He also advised me to ride the Caltrain to the Giants' games that I attended. That saved me lots of money!!!! It was just a wonderful trip and the hotel was fantastic!

managementResponses.response: Thank you, Charles, for commenting on your recent experience at Bay Landing. We are sorry that we failed to meet your expectations. I have reviewed your comments with our housekeeping team, and we will be sure to remove the linen from our inventory. We are happy to provide you with additional pillows on request. We do anticipate a rooms renovation towards the end of the year, and hope to see you again after it has been completed. Thank you again for your business.

review.title: Not what we expected based on previous stays
review.reviewText: We enjoyed the view we had of the bay and airport runway. The lobby is still lovely. However, that's about where we began our descent into dissatisfaction. Our linens were a disgrace. Not since we stayed in $30 a night hotels many, many years ago have we encountered gray-yellowish linens that should have been white, both towels and sheets. Worse, the sheets had at least 3 holes in them! The pillows were extraordinarily small, and there were only 3 of them, for a king bed. The chairs in the breakfast room were frayed beyond normal wear and tear. For a similar price for other hotels of equal rating we've never encountered these glaring short comings. We've stayed at this hotel twice during the past 3-4 years but the conditions were not what we experienced this time. Consequently we will not stay again at this hotel, or recommend it to others.
review.positiveRemarks: The view, the airport shuttle, the location, a good nearby restaurant, breakfast was ok.
review.negativeRemarks: New linens, and reupholstering of dining area chairs.
review.locationRemarks: Close proximity to public transportation into the city, and the city of Millbrae.

managementResponses.response: Thank you, Homer, for taking the time to comment on the faucet in your room, our complimentary breakfast, and the television selection. We appreciate your patronage, and do hope that you will consider staying with us again in the future.

review.title: Expect more, get less
review.reviewText:
For the price of the room, we expected more amenities. At a minimum, we thought the hotel would have a cafe or restaurant. We read breakfast would be provided, but were startled to find it was thawed frozen eggs and access to a microwave oven. No information about how long to zap the food; we overheated ours.

The television menu steers you to upsell; the "watch TV" option required paging down to a new set of options. And the reception was so awful on local station KGO-TV, that we just turned it off.

review.title: Quite surprised...
review.reviewText:
We did not have high expectations, but were OK with everything we had read and the pics we viewed online. Don't
judge a book by its cover. The staff was outstanding. The only request we had was for them to light the outside fire pit at night, which they did immediately. It was especially nice and romantic for my birthday. The rooms are clean, spacious, and well-equipped. Breakfast includes eggs, fruit, oatmeal, whole wheat toast, yogurt, green tea, and nonfat milk for health-conscious people (like us). Gym does not include weights, but there is a beautiful trail in back along the bay that runs alongside SFO, and is quite beautiful watching the planes and water. Accessible to nice restaurants, the freeway, and BART. Only drawback for us: carpets seemed worn, but can't wait to come back otherwise!

review.title: Delightful hotel by the bay
review.reviewText: We felt very comfortable in this hotel. The room, especially the king size bed was very comfortable and the staff were so friendly and helpful that it made our experience very pleasant. We were advised to take a City Tour with Tower Tours and this was really excellent because, not only was it an excellent tour, but they picked us up at the hotel which made life so much easier than having to find our own way to the city and take a tour. We were left back to the hotel and it was all trouble free for us. The hotel is beautifully situated right next to the bay and we could walk along the path or just sit and relax beside the water. Breakfast was good and wifi was so good to have in our room and even out on the patio. We would definitely recommend this hotel as a hotel close to the airport and within easy reach of the city.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfortable bed, pleasant and efficient staff, proximity to airport and bay view.
review.negativeRemarks: Perhaps quicker shuttle service from airport as we had to wait quite a while, and coming from Eastern time zone we were very tired.
review.locationRemarks: Good location for airport but quite far from city but that problem was solved by pick up from the hotel on the tour we took.

review.title: Windows open!
review.reviewText:
There are only a few hotels in all of US that enable guests to open the room window. This opportunity is much appreciated especially in seasons when heating/air conditioning is not needed. It allows fresh air & saves energy, a win-win situation. Please keep it that way. This is why we alway chose this hotel when in S.F. area regardless of the cost per room.
Your breakfasts are also very good and the staff is helpful and cordial. We recommend this hotel to all our friends.
review.positiveRemarks: There is really nothing we did not like. The location is actually very good: an easy access to HWYs.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing really

I felt the guy on reception could have been a bit more friendly on our arrival which was a little disappointing - overall good value for money with the benefit of free free airport transfers.

Good breakfast, nice rooms, great staff. Probably one of the best for your money in the area close to SFO airport.

Normally I would stay at a branded hotel and if anyone is considering the Bay Landing prepare to be disappointed.

review.title: Beautiful Bay View
review.reviewText: I just stayed at the Bay Landing Hotel for 2 nights with my husband and 9 month baby. The hotel staff couldn't be more accommodating and helpful. Very great service, nice big comfy room for us. I requested a crib and got a good size crib delivered to our room in minutes. We had a bay view and it was a nice view. The noise was not a factor at all, especially with being so close to the airport, it was actually quite peaceful and calming. The only thing that I had a problem with was the refrigerator. With having a baby, I needed the fridge to keep all her food in but ours smelled like salsa. I went to the nearest grocery store and bought lysol wipes and tried to clean it out myself, but I could not get the smell out. It was pretty bad that everything we stored in the fridge smelled. Other than that, our room was clean, breakfast was good, parking was great, and our overall experience was excellent.
review.positiveRemarks: View, Comfortable Bed, close to freeway and stores, free parking, free wifi, free breakfast

review.title: Best Bayside hotel of all time!
review.reviewText: This is our second trip to San Francisco and this time around we had a blast. We stayed at a Hilton Hotel the first time. It was nice, but more expensive, no free wi-fi, no free breakfast and we certainly didn't get the same view we received at the Bay Landing. The Bay Landing Hotel is downright beautiful. I thought for the amount we were paying that we weren't going to get the same amount of luxury, but I was dead wrong. We upgraded to a Bayside view when we got in (20 extra per day) and when we got the room we were invited by a glorious view. It was so nice to wake up to the nice breeze and it set the mood for a good day. Yes the airport is right across from the bay, but in all honesty the double window panes pretty much blocked out any noise and we got sound sleep all three nights we stayed there. The staff is amazing, they helped us out throughout our trip with information and we always came back to a made up room after a long day. The free breakfast in the morning isn't the most top notch breakfast of all time, but it's FREE. They have the typical waffler makers and omelettes, and of course toast and muffins. They have juice and coffee in the morning as well and serve coffee all day to guests (found this to be VERY helpful). They even had cookies out at night for guests coming back in :) Everything was clean in the hotel, no shoddiness of any kind and the surrounding neighborhood is quiet and peaceful if you wanted to take a walk along the bay. One of the best hotels!
review.positiveRemarks: FREE wi-fi, cleanliness of the lobby, dining area & rooms of the hotel itself :) Close to the water so we got the nice, fresh breeze of the SF bay.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing, honestly :)
review.locationRemarks: Elephant Bar is walking distance!!

review.title: Good Hotel on the Bay at the Airport
review.reviewText: Good hotel in a really convenient location for both the airport and a stay in San Francisco if you don't want to pay city prices. They have a free airport shuttle that drops you off at the BART at the International Terminal and a 30 minute ride takes you right to Powell Street station. The staff are very helpful and the breakfast is good as long as there is space in the small breakfast room - summer offers a terrace for breakfast on the Bay. Free parking at the hotel and a few restaurants around it for easy dining options. Bedroom was large and comfortable with coffee maker and fridge in room. Plumbing is very noisy and you can hear upstairs rooms running water and flushing toilets - suggest you get a top floor room to negate this.
review.positiveRemarks: Good hotel staff, comfortable beds and great location for an airport hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Noisy plumbing - the sound proofing on the plumbing is virtually non-existent and it spoils a really good hotel.

We were grateful to be able to get ride at 4:46 a.m. to arrive at the airport by 5:00 a.m. for a 6:00 a.m. flight. What would have made the stay perfect under these circumstances would have been to be able, when checking in, to request a to-go light breakfast. They offer a breakfast starting at 6:00 a.m., which we would miss. We were told coffee and hot chocolate would be available before the time of our shuttle, but they were not. Otherwise, we found the hotel to be quite nice.

Everything from cereal and fruit to waffles, pancakes, bacon and even omelettes, huge choice of muffins, croissants and muffins. It was busy when we arrived to eat, but there was a continual filling up of everything available and it was delightful. Many thanks for a very nice end to our five weeks of travel.

review.title: Great alternative to SF hotels
review.reviewText: When I travel to SF I usually stay south of the City because rates are much more reasonable and there's free parking. Among the many places I've stayed, Bay Landing is a real stand-out. It's family owned and the attention to quality is obvious. Friendly, efficient check-in with complimentary cookies. Plenty of parking spots. Great buffet breakfast with lots of choices, and the area was kept stocked and tidy. Everything was in good repair and clean. Comfortable bed. Flat screen TV. Right on the bay, next to a walking trail. We were given a disabled access room, which was awesome. One tip: to turn on the shower, pull the faucet handle OUT, then turn it. Haha...took me a while to figure that out.

review.title: Definitely 5 star!
review.reviewText:
As soon as my husband and I arrived and entered the spacious, light-filled lobby, we felt good! We did not think our room would be ready at 11:30 but the desk clerk offered to check for us and then offered to store our luggage while we returned our rental car to SFO. We were spending the night at Bay Landing before flying home in the morning.
After having lunch at nearby restaurant our room was ready..........clean, pretty, with a beautiful view of the bay.......and......my favorite thing tho not a common amenity......the lovely paned windows could slide open at least six inches. Fresh air!!
We shall always stay there.....and will recommend it highly to our friends and family.

review.title: My SFO getaway!
review.reviewText: Actually it was a work conference that took me to San Francisco. The Marriott was booked full for conference goers and Bay Landing was listed as within walking distance. I liked that! But, wow! It's in a great location on the water and walking path. I loved, just loved, watching the jets take off and land across the bay. The staff was very helpful, the room was clean and very comfortable...making my stay kind of easy and homey...in a way. The room wasn't too small, it had what I wanted and needed. The breakfast was beyond my expectations and the floor staff and front office staff were very helpful and courteous. The dining area did remind me of Europe and I enjoyed having water and beverages available all day. My stay was very, very pleasant. I would stay again for my own vacation.

review.title: It was an ok stay.
review.reviewText: We stayed at this hotel because of a wedding we were attending. We came in early, 1 pm and check in time was 3 pm. But we explained that we needed to prepare for the wedding and needed to get in the room early. The agent insisted that the room was not ready. Long story short, in fact the rooms were ready - another agent let us in. This is not a big complaint, just an annoyance with the lack of flexibility and understanding of the front personnel. Overall, the hotel is average, the price being on the high side but perhaps due to the fact it is close to SFO airport. The rooms facing the water has a nice view of the SFO runways and so, if you enjoy watching planes landing and taking off, the view is nice.
review.positiveRemarks: The view on the water side of the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Better flexibility of check in policy.

review.title: Nice hotel on the St. Francisco Bay
review.reviewText:
Very nice, very clean, perfect location if you intend to use a car (free parking, with plenty of space and location very close to highway 101, which allows an easy access to South (San Jose, Monterey) or North (San Bruno, San Francisco).

We stayed 6 nights and enjoyed every moment of our staying in the hotel area. We also got a bay view which was nice, especially in the mornings with a clear sky, while looking at the sunrise.

Nice terrace outside allowed us to have our breakfast outside.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to the airport. Free shuttle. Free parking. Surrounded by several restaurants. Clean. Very good breakfast. Coffee and cookies in the afternoon.

The hotel is very convenient for those who seek relaxation.

(Don't worry you won't be affected with the flights noise @ Night). It is about 20 minutes far from SF down down , few minutes from the airport , and there are 2 restaurants within a walking distance (2 min) , also San Bruno area , 10 minutes far by car , is a good option for dinning or shopping.

review.title: Great hotel & staff, free breakfast & parking!
review.reviewText:
This was a great hotel! We checked in late, around 10pm, after going to a Giants game straight from traveling. The front desk was friendly as everything went smoothly. We had free parking, which is fantastic considering anywhere else you go in SF you will pay $10-30 everytime you park!

There was a nice free breakfast in the morning- your standard coffee, cereal, waffles, yogurt, fruits, eggs, bacon, juices, etc. There was enough room for our family of 4 each morning and plenty more room on the patio if you want to watch the planes land and view the ocean. Coffee and water were always available in the lobby and there is a nice little mini-convenient store/booth in the lobby as well.

We didn't notice any excessive noise, the beds were comfortable enough, the rooms were clean enough. Each room has an individual AC, the hotel (I believe) does not have central AC, so the hallways got a little warm, but we didn't really spend any time in the hallways! We had plenty of hot water and great water pressure- the free toiletries were also very nice!

Check out was easy, rates were great, we really got everything we expected! The hotel is also located right off the freeway with easy access and within walking distance to the Elephant Bar (call 2 hrs prior for reservations or 30min ahead for seating or expect to WAIT) and a Mexican restaurant as well as a few others if you want to drive.
review.positiveRemarks: Free parking, free breakfast, friendly staff, good location, hot water, good water pressure, comfortable beds.
review.negativeRemarks: Room was a little outdated and couldn't been a little cleaner.
review.locationRemarks: About 20-30 minutes from the city, check GPS for traffic reports. Next door to Elephant Bar and Mexican Restaurant, right off the 101.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Steve,

review.title: Extraordinary hotel
review.reviewText: We used this hotel for an overnight stay prior to an early morning flight from SFO. When we checked in we were bowled over with the room and the staff. The room exceeded any expectations. It was roomy, quiet, comfortable. The bed was great. The bath was even better, both an extra large stall shower and a tub, with plenty of space. The morning continental breakfast was much more than the usual continental fair, eggs, fruit, cereal (hot & cold), all types of breads, toasters that worked, coffee and juices, and yogurts. On time transfer to SFO with a driver who was polite and informed. Would go back to this facility in a NY minute, it was great!
review.positiveRemarks: Everything
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing

review.title: Great facility, average staff
review.reviewText:
Good hotel, nice view of the bay, very good breakfast. Rooms are clean and well-kept. Downside: pay-per-view movies are $14.99 each...and didn't seem to be well advertized as such on-screen...the price was a surprise at checkout. Booked and paid in advance for a bay-view room, but when we checked in they put us in a street-view room. Had to go back down the desk and get it corrected; front desk staff then seemed a little curt, rushed, on the edge of rude.

Everything else was good to excellent. Three nice places to eat within 1 min walking distance; Benihanna's, Elephant Bar, and El Torito.
review.positiveRemarks: Facility. Cleanliness. View of the bay. Walking distance to rest. Park along the water.
review.negativeRemarks: Don't advertise a bay view room if you are not going to check for that and assign it as such at check-in. Front counter staff could be a little kinder
review.locationRemarks: Free shuttle to SFO. Restaurants within walking distance. BART station is a 3 min drive, with $2/day parking. $8.60 per person round trip to SF

Hotel staff, the guy was excellent the girl could of had more patience with people that have never been to San Francisco. Over all I would for sure stay again.

review.title: Great Hotel Near SFO
review.reviewText: I had a one-night stay at the Bay Landing Hotel after landing at SFO in the evening. I waited at the airport for about 10 minutes for the free airport shuttle. The hotel was clean and neat, with all plumbing fixtures well maintained. I could see the SF bay from my room, even though I did not pay for a view room. Staff was very helpful in arranging transportation to my business meeting the next day. For a late dinner I walked a short distance to the Elephant Bar, which offered a wide variety of selections. The free continental breakfast the hotel offered the next morning had a better selection than most. Overall, I had a very pleasant experience and I would gladly return to the Bay Landing Hotel.

review.title: Very nice hotel with terrific scenery
review.reviewText: Good experience. The area where breakfast is served is a little congested because of space, but that is minor compared to all of the other amenities and location of the hotel. Very nice place!

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText:
Hotel was located very close to the airport without the airport noise. The view of the water was also very nice.

The only drawback was there was no pool. The air conditioning in the room was either too cold or too hot; it was very hard to regulate it.

The breakfast in the morning had good quality food and tasted great. However, the logistics of the layout of where the food was located and the fact that some of it had to be heated in only 2 microwave's available created a pretty big bottleneck. Moving either the food around (not stuck in a corner) or placing the microwave's somewhere else rather than in the middle of all the food might help with the guests running into each other and standing around waiting.

review.title: nice location
review.reviewText: I and my parents stayed in this hotel on the last night in San Fransisco. The location is great. You can see the sea and airport without noises. Staff is friendly and google the address of BOA for us. It is so easily drive to Airport Rental Car and catch the flight.
review.negativeRemarks: 6 minutes drive to downtown, 6minutes drive to SF Inter airport

review.title: Quiet and Clean
review.reviewText: The hotel is elegant on a smaller scale compared to the oversized monopoly chains. It had a welcoming feel of home. Free parking in the parking lot, professional service from all staff I encountered, clean and spacious rooms and bathroom( very important), free wifi,complimentary warm freshly baked cookies in lobby during the early evening( yummy!), beautiful view of the bay from our room, next door to many restaurants 2min walking distance, and a complimentary breakfast including a variety of different common items like different cereals, omelets, breads, muffins, pastries, yogurt, granola, fruit, juice, and last but not least, you can easily make your own thick waffles at the waffle station! That's my favorite part. :) I've stayed here many times over the years and have never been disappointed with anything. The only things I think could improve is updating the old box Tvs in the rooms with flat screens and replacing the flower pattern bed covers with solids, or something simple.

review.title: Hotel is about 10 minutes from SFO.
review.reviewText:
We had a wonderful view of the bay. The room was very quiet even though we were facing the runway.
The beds were very comfortable and breakfast was also great. The staff was very friendly and we will stay here again on our next visit to San Francisco. You can take the hotel shuttle to the SFO airport and catch BART to the downtown area. there are a couple of restaurants right next door.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing

review.title: Good bang for your buck
review.reviewText: Hotel is a little on the older side, but very clean with nice sized rooms and a beautiful courtyard with views of the bay...AC blows cold air just on this side of perfect and the remote control for the thermostat made it easy to adjust in the middle of the night without needing to get up. Their breakfast was awesome...make your own waffles ( mini or super sized) great variety of items and staff manning it and "refilling" as needed. Parking included near the airport...need I say more? Overall I would and will go back to stay there. Definitely a great bang for your buck.

review.title: OK-Nothing more-Nothing less
review.reviewText: Overall the hotel is OK. Standard airport hotel, nothing more, nothing less. The location is OK, close to the airport with quick efficient transportation to and from the property, close to BART or Caltrain as well, but very out of the way, downtown Burlingame is quite nice. Continental breakfast was disappointing with very cramped set up for the food making it uncomfortable to get anything for breakfast.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to airport and BART
review.negativeRemarks: Continental breakfast
review.locationRemarks: Easy to get to BART and downtown Burlingame

review.title: fantastic experience!
review.reviewText:
This hotel was absolutely fantastic to stay at! It was easy to find, easy to check in, and the room was spotless. The bathroom was super clean, and the tub even had a granite surround! Our view was over the bay, and in the morning we got to watch a magnificent sunrise (we had to get up early to catch our flight).

Breakfast started at 6am and included more than I've ever seen for a complimentary breakfast - cereal, muffins, donuts, bagels, toast, bacon, hard-boiled eggs, pancakes, waffles, sausage biscuits, yogurt, pudding, jello, and a variety of fresh fruit. There was also milk (whole, 2%, and skim), coffee, and several juices. I'm probably forgetting some stuff too!

The shuttle arrived exactly at the time it was scheduled, and took less than 10 min to get us to the airport. And the driver was very courteous and friendly!

The hotel staff were professional and helpful, although not overly friendly. Still, no complaints!

review.title: Choose another hotel
review.reviewText: Staff was very unfriendly, had to move rooms 3 times as there was no internet access. The facilities of the hotel were minimal at best. I stayed in this hotel for 14 days and from day one it was uncomfortable and not welcoming. The free breakfast was a joke. I would not recommend this hotel and it should be rated at best a 2 star.
review.locationRemarks: nothing

review.title: Suggested by a Friend
review.reviewText:
Suggested by a friend who frequently travels between both coasts; and who resides in the San Francisco area.
Pleasantly appointed, extremely clean and accommodating - excellent gratis breakfast with a peaceful patio on which to enjoy your meal. There is also an accessible partial walkway around the water.
Staff extremely helpful with providing local transportation guidance (BART and airport schedule service). Free parking!
Close to restaurants i.e. Benihana, The Elephant Bar and Restaurant. Other small luncheon and breakfast places as well. Holler and you will find the infamous ' In and Out Burger'!
Plenty of towels, water pressure with a complimentary paper - coffee/tea and refrigerator in the Wifi'd room
I would go back and recommend to all in a heartbeat! You know, I left my heart in San Francisco. . .. Enjoy!
(ps. does not have a pool but does have a well-equipped gym.)

I chose this hotel for the price and free wifi. I don't think I'll choose it again though. I didn't like the room and the overall atmosphere, but that's just me.

All in all we would recommend this hotel and would not hesitate to stay again.
